derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'theatrical'): via Latin from Greek sknikos 'of the stage', from skēnē (see scene)

entry.tran: (地方)景色优美的，风景秀丽的
entry.def: A scenic place has attractive scenery.

example.ex: This is an extremely scenic part of America.
example.tran: 这是美国风景非常秀丽的一个地区。
穿越景色优美的乡间的两个小时车程

entry.def: A scenic route goes through attractive scenery and has nice views.

example.ex: It was even marked on the map as a scenic route...
example.tran: 它甚至还作为观光路线标在了地图上。

example.ex: I went some miles out of my way to take the scenic road into Macon.
example.tran: 我绕行了几英里，想要经由那条风景秀丽的公路进入梅肯。

entry.def: If a place has scenic beauty, its scenery is attractive.

means.word_mean: 1. used of locations; having beautiful natural scenery;
2. of or relating to the stage or stage scenery;
